file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 38-32-06-04 - TOILET DRAIN CABLE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TOILET DRAIN CABLE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the toilet drain cable. B. The toilet drain cable goes through a conduit and is attached to the toilet unit and to the waste service panel with nuts. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ACFT MODEL(S) 38-32-06-000-801-A TOILET DRAIN CABLE - REMOVAL EMB-145 ACFT MODEL(S) 38-32-06-400-801-A TOILET DRAIN CABLE - INSTALLATION EMB-145 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-1 38-32-06 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 38-32-06-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 2. TOILET DRAIN CABLE - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedure for removal of the toilet drain cable. (2) To get access to the toilet drain cable, you must remove: the toilet shroud assembly, the last double seat, the optional flight attendant seat (if applicable), the passenger-cabin floor lining, and passenger-cabin floor panel 262BF. You must also open the waste-service panel door. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM TASK 25-21-01-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-21-02-000-801-A/400 FLIGHT ATTENDANT SEAT - REMOVAL AMM TASK 25-24-01-000-801-A/400 PASSENGER-CABIN FLOOR LINING - REMOVAL AMM TASK 25-40-04-000-801-A/400 TOILET SHROUD ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 262 262BF Passenger cabin floor 172 272AR Rear right side of the fuselage bottom D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Under the passenger cabin floor 1 Helps with the task Outside the aircraft EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 38-32-06 Page 2 of 6 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-012-A (1) Remove the toilet shroud assembly ( AMM TASK 25-40-04-000-801-A/400). (2) Remove the last double seat (AMM TASK 25-21-01-000-801-A/400). (3) If applicable, remove the optional flight attendant seat ( AMM TASK 25-21-02-000-801- A/400). (4) Remove the passenger-cabin floor lining ( AMM TASK 25-24-01-000-801-A/400). (5) Remove passenger-cabin floor panel 262BF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). (6) Open waste-service panel door 272AR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-012-A (1) Remove the nuts (1) that attach the upper part of the toilet drain cable (3) to the support (Ref.). (2) Loosen the toilet-drain cable nut (2). (3) Get access through the passenger cabin floor and remove the sealant from the nut (5) and washer (4). (4) Remove the nut (5) and washer (4) that attach the lower part of the toilet drain cable (3) to the waste service panel. (5) Remove and discard the tiedown strap (6) (Applicable only to aircraft S/N 145030 and on). (6) Through the waste service panel, remove the toilet drain cable (3) together with its conduit. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 38-32-06 Page 3 of 6 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 38-32-06-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 3. TOILET DRAIN CABLE - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure for installation of the toilet drain cable. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM TASK 25-21-01-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-21-02-400-801-A/400 FLIGHT ATTENDANT SEAT - INSTALLATION PASSENGER-CABIN FLOOR LINING - INSTALLA- AMM TASK 25-24-01-400-801-A/400 TION AMM TASK 25-40-04-400-801-A/400 TOILET SHROUD ASSEMBLY - INSTALLATION IPC 38-32-06 TOILET DRAIN CABLE SRM 51-20-01 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 262 262BF Passenger cabin floor 172 272AR Rear right side of the fuselage bottom D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MIL-S-8802, TYPE II, CLASS B2 Sealant, PR 1440 B2 AR LOCTITE 221 (MEP 09-005) Anaerobic Adhesive - Type I Loctite 221 AR G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Tiedown strap IPC 38-32-06 1 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 38-32-06 Page 5 of 6 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Under the passenger cabin floor 1 Helps with the task Outside the aircraft I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-012-A (1) Through the waste service panel, put the toilet drain cable (3) in position together with its conduit. (2) Get access through the passenger cabin floor and install the nut (5) and washer (4) that attach the lower part of the toilet drain cable (3) to the waste service panel. (3) Apply sealant to the nut (5) and washer (4) (SRM 51-20-01). (4) Connect the toilet-drain cable nut (2). (5) Install the nuts (1) that attach the upper part of the toilet drain cable (3) to the support (Ref.). (6) NOTE: Make sure that you install the new tiedown strap (6) in the correct position. Refer to DET. B and DET. D. (7) Install a new tiedown strap (6). (8) Make sure that the bolt (9) that attaches the handle (7) is tight. (9) If you think that the bolt (9) will possibly come loose on the handle (7), do the steps that follow: 1. Remove the bolt (9) and washer (8) from the handle (7) and apply a thin layer of the Loctite 221 adhesive to their threads. 2. Install the washer (8) and the bolt (9). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-012-A (1) Close waste-service panel door 272AR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (2) Install passenger-cabin floor panel 262BF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). (3) Install the passenger-cabin floor lining ( AMM TASK 25-24-01-400-801-A/400). (4) If applicable, install the optional flight attendant seat ( AMM TASK 25-21-02-400-801- A/400). (5) Install the last double seat (AMM TASK 25-21-01-400-801-A/400). (6) Install the toilet shroud assembly ( AMM TASK 25-40-04-400-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 38-32-06 Page 6 of 6 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
